intro: Lotononis dinteri var. amboensus, commonly known as the Amboensis lotononis, is a rare and endemic species native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and grayish-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale blue flowers that bloom during the cooler months, typically in the spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
